Steps to reproduce:

Opening composer page at start-up.


Actual results:

The browser function is grayed out by default and can only be addressed by switching between the ‚Äònormal‚Äô tab and one of the other three (e.g. source) at the page bottom.


Expected results:

At start-up of composer opening a page to edit, the browser function should not be grayed out. Older versions in the past did not have this problem.

Summary: In the html<source> view the search command/f shortcut does not work.
Description:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_12_6) AppleWebKit/605.1.15 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/12.1.2 Safari/605.1.15

Steps to reproduce:

Enter the command/f shortcut in html<source> view does not work.


Actual results:

In the html<source> view, in order to search the source page, the command/f shortcut does not work, the only way is to click within the page and then select from the edit menu the option find and replace. Simple search does not work. The shortcut for this does not work either.


Expected results:

Search function in source mode should respond to shortcut and simple search common from menu. In older versions long ago this function was still intact.

Summary: Merging cells after creating a table is deficient.
Description:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_12_6) AppleWebKit/605.1.15 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/12.1.2 Safari/605.1.15

Steps to reproduce:

Creating a table with two columns and several rows gives trouble when trying to unite them.


Actual results:

Creating a table with e.g. two columns and 9 rows gives trouble. When one wants to join selected cells, one cannot select more than two cells to unite at a time. When finally two cells are left, these two cannot be united. For that purpose an extra row must be created, then the two previous cells can be united, whereupon the extra row can be deleted.


Expected results:

More easy and supple uniting of cells in a created table..

Summary: cutting and pasting links and images by default a local link is offered.

Steps to reproduce:

Cut and pasting links and images


Actual results:

All links are by default changed into local links, exept for http- links, so that for each copy/paste action for links and images the links must be adapted before uploading the page to one's site. Furthermore in later versions It is not possible anymore to set the link correct for both image source and for a relative link on that image, so that one must adapt the trouble in source mode. Also it is compulsory to check for alternative text in image link editor. 


Expected results:

1) The default for copying links and images should be a relative link, not a local one, 2) both link and picture source one must be able to correct, and 3) checking the checkbox for an alternative text for a picture should not be compulsory. The first two issues were functional in previous versions, but have been lost in later updates. The latter issue always has been so.

Summary: dropping of addresses from Address Book into a compose window address field is handled twice
Description:
As frg observed, dragging and dropping contacts from the address book into a compose window address field does not produce the expected result - if contacts abc, def and xyz are selected, and dropped in the first empty address field, the result will be something like:

To: abcabc, def, xyz
To: def
To: xyz


This is present in 2.53.9b1pre and also in 2.49.5. This appears to be caused by the drop event being handled twice. The field where the selection is dropped gets the corresponding address (in this case abc), and the whole selection as a comma-separated list. If "abc" is long enough, and depending on the drop location inside the field, the comma-separated list may appear in the middle of "abc". Using "undo" in the affected field then shows "abc".

This was bug 1267804 for Thunderbird, and adding event.preventDefault() before "if (onWidget)" inside DropOnAddressingTarget() (see bug 1708999) seems to help.

Summary: Addresses dragged from addressbook into Select Addresses window appear as single entry

1/ Open the address book window
2/ Open a compose window
3/ Select the "Address" button, which will open a "Select Addresses" dialog.
4/ Select multiple email addresses in the address book window
5/ Drag and drop them into the "address message to:" pane in the "Select Addresses" dialog.

Expected result
1/ An entry per email address.

Actual result
1/ A single entry containing all the dropped email addresses.

Summary: 2.53.7.1 fails to build against nss-3.65
Description:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:78.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/78.0

Steps to reproduce:

Tried to build seamonkey-2.53.7.1 using the instructions at BLFS,
https://www.linuxfromscratch.org/blfs/view/svn/xsoft/seamonkey.html


Actual results:

With gcc-11.1.0 and nss-3.65 the build fell over in IDBTransaction.h at the CLEANUP enum:
/scratch/working/seamonkey-2.53.7.1/obj-x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/dist/include/mozilla/dom/IDBTransaction.h: At global scope:
/scratch/working/seamonkey-2.53.7.1/obj-x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/dist/includemozilla/dom/IDBTransaction.h:62:5: error: expected identifier before '(' token
   62 |     CLEANUP,
      |     ^~~~~~~

Today, someone who is still using gcc-10.2.0 reported a similar error:

 In file included from /home/pro/rpmbuild/BUILD/seamonkey-2.53.7.1/obj-x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/dom/bindings/IDBDatabaseBinding.cpp:16:
 /home/pro/rpmbuild/BUILD/seamonkey-2.53.7.1/obj-x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/dist/include/mozilla/dom/IDBTransaction.h:197:21: error: use of  undeclared identifier 'cleanup'
 mMode == CLEANUP ||
 ^
 /usr/include/nss/pk11hpke.h:13:5: note: expanded from macro 'CLEANUP'
 cleanup
 ^
He was able to identify that nss was involved, and fixed this by downgrading nss to 3.64. Doing that also fixed my build with gcc-11.1.0.

Not sure whether seamonkey or nss is the problem, but since only seamonkey seems to be affected I'll start here.





Expected results:

Successful compilation

Summary: switch to VT and back disconnects IRC server
Description:
original summary:
switch to VT and back disconnects IRC server

To Reproduce:
1 open Chatzilla in SeaMonkey (e.g. v2.53.7.1)
2 open an IRC server, e.g. freenode
3 open a channel, e.g. #seamonkey
4 switch to any of vtty 3-6
5 wait indeterminate time (usually a minute or more)
6 switch back to Xorg

Actual Behavior:
1 IRC server disconnected with "Connection to irc://freenode/ ... timed out" at the instant of return to X

Expected Behavior:
1 IRC server connection is and has been maintained while VT has sole focus

Notes:
1 this is old, estimated at least 3 years, possibly even 5+, before which connection was never broken on account of switch to VT and back
2 this is not reproduced at will on all installations, if at all. e.g. On this openSUSE 15.2 PC running KDE3, which is an upgrade of an upgrade ad infinitum where I first noticed the breakage, I only noticed recently difficulty in reproducing, while on another PC running Plasma on Xorg on Fedora 34, it reproduced on first attempt.
3 SM startup exporting MOZ_LOG="nsIOService:5 nsSocketTransport:5 TCPSocket:5" & MOZ_LOG_FILE= on the same Fedora 34 took several attempts over a long time to reproduce.
4 I subsequently tried again to reproduce on this openSUSE 15.2, which succeeded.
5 I have often noticed on return to VT a fresh email pull in progress if the return is to the virtual desktop on which SeaMonkey Mail, running in a separate SM instance, is open
6 MOZ_NO_REMOTE=1 is always set here via .bashrc here due to use of two SM instances (profiles) running most of the time
7 significant discussion of this has transpired on irc://freenode/#seamonkey beginning 21:40 UTC May 25

 Line: 148

Seems to be bad interaction between tabbrowser.xml and suite/browser/nsBrowserStatusHandler.js

Summary: Percent-encode square brackets when copying from location bar
Description:
When you select and copy text from the location bar that contains special characters, these characters get automatically percent-encoded during the copy.  This helpfully turns the human-readable location presented by SeaMonkey into a syntactically valid URI for pasting into other documents/applications.  For example, the location text `https://www.example.com/this is a test/` gets copied as `https://www.example.com/this%20is%20a%20test/`.

However, this percent-encoding doesn't happen correctly with square brackets, which per [RFC 3986](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3986.txt) are permitted only in the host subcomponent, and even then only to specify an IP literal.  So for example the location `https://[::1]/this[is]a[test]` gets incorrectly copied as-is, when it should in fact be copied as `https://[::1]/this%5Bis%5Da%5Btest%5D`.

In SeaMonkey 2.53.8 moving messages to archive does not work (Message > Archive or Shift+A). I noticed this problem after upgrading from 2.53.6 to 2.53.8. This doesn't work both for IMAP and POP3 accounts. My folder settings are default: archiving should move the message to the Archive folder on the account.

After some unsuccessful testing I reverted to 2.53.7.1 and archiving started to work again.

Summary: web page map will not load
Description:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:60.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/60.0

Steps to reproduce:

open site https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/safety/wildfire-status
click on "B.C. Wildfire Dashboard"


Actual results:

https://governmentofbc.maps.arcgis.com/apps/dashboards  
opens in new tab but you get an error
Cannot open map 'BC Wildfires - Provincial Current Year Fires'


Expected results:

on both firefox and chrome you get a nice interactive map showing all the fires in British Colombia Canada.
I am running slackware current
am running seamonkey 2.53.8 with 
User agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:60.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/60.0
Build identifier: 20210621183615

Summary: Format Toolbar forgets its hidden status when switching to other view modes
Description:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:60.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/60.0 SeaMonkey/2.53.8

Steps to reproduce:

-open a new Composer window
-View‚ÜíShow/Hide‚ÜíFormat Toolbar
-the toolbar is hidden
-View‚Üíany of these:Normal Edit Mode,HTML Tags,Preview


Actual results:

the toolbar shows up after switching


Expected results:

the toolbar keeps hidden

Summary: Email archive function missing in SeaMonkey 2.53.8
Description:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:60.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/60.0

Steps to reproduce:

Select any email message in any folder (Inbox, etc)
Press Shift+A, or right click select Archive, or click menu Message select Archive


Actual results:

nothing happens


Expected results:

email message should have been moved to subfolder
Archives => <year> => <year-month> ... like Archives => 2021-07

Summary: message archiving does not work
Description:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:60.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/60.0 SeaMonkey/2.53.8

Steps to reproduce:

1) In the e-mail client, select a message in the Inbox.
2) Right-click, then click on Archive.



Actual results:

The message is not moved to the Archives folder.


Expected results:

The message should be moved from Inbox to Archives.

Summary: Impossible to send email with only address lists in "To"!
Description:
Steps how to reproduce NOT reproducible REPRODUCIBLE with installation of unofficial (by wg9s) De SeaMonkey 2.53.9 beta 1 Mozilla/5.0  (NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:60.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/60.0 Build 20210707210003 (Newly created User Profile, Default Classic Theme) on German WIN7 64bit

1. Launch SM Mail
2. From arbitrary email account open mail compose window
3. Àãin "To:" address field start to type name of existing recipients  list ‚Üí let autocomplete do it's work ‚Üí 'Enter' to select existing listÀä
   ¬ª Expected: 'Send' icon becomes active  
     actual: stays  inactive (greyed)
   
a) I'ts impossible to send mail
b) Adding a normal email address to a different addreess field (as CC) heals the problem, send button becomes active, mail can be sent.
b1) you will see that all recipients from  list will have been inserted.
c) looks a little similar to "Bug 1681913 - Send button disabled for mailing list with colon in list name as only recipient" - but for all address lists
d) was oK with 2.53.8

Summary: SeaMonkey not supported
Description:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:60.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/60.0 SeaMonkey/2.53.8

Steps to reproduce:

I opened https://www.telekom.de/start


Actual results:

Notice:

Ihr Browser wird nicht mehr unterst√ºtzt.
Diese Seite kann Ihnen m√∂glicherweise nicht mehr richtig dargestellt werden, da Ihr Browser nicht mehr unterst√ºtzt wird bzw. es sich um eine veraltete Version handelt. F√ºr das beste Nutzungserlebnis empfehlen wir Ihnen die aktuellste Version von Chrome, Firefox, Safari oder Edge. 


Expected results:

Normal page without notice!

Summary: Archive function in Messenger doesn't move message
Description:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:60.0) Gecko/20100101 SeaMonkey/2.53.8

Steps to reproduce:

I highlight a mail in Messengers inbox and press Shift+A, or right click and choose "Archive" or use menu "Mesage" -> "Archive".


Actual results:

Nothing


Expected results:

The email should be moved to the configured archive folder.

It work for me in SeaMonkey 2.53.7.1 but not in SeaMonkey 2.53.8b1 and SeaMonkey 2.53.8.

I am using the same profile when testing SeaMonkey 2.53.7.1 and SeaMonkey 2.53.8

Summary: welcome_help.xhtml: update IRC channel link to point to libera.chat
keyboard shortcut "m" to change message status as unread does not work
Description:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:89.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/89.0

Steps to reproduce:

Select a message with Read status
Press "m" to change status as unread


Actual results:

Nothing, message still with Read status.


Expected results:

Message shout change status to Unread. It worked till version 2.53.7 but after upgrade to 2.53.8 it stops working. I found workaroud - press Shift+m works.
It is inconsistent behaviour, in Thunderbird still works pressing "m".

Summary: Don't preserve offlineMsgSize parameter when move/copy emails between folders
Description: The "offlineMsgSize" parameter should be added to "mailnews.database.summary.dontPreserveOn{Copy,Move}" to avoid possible corruption of imap offline database and incorrect display of emails.

Summary: pdf attachments cannot be read from mail and news if Pdf viewer 2.3.233 add-on is installed
Description:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:60.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/60.0

Steps to reproduce:

I receive a message containing a .pdf file as attachement and try to open the file from mail and news.


Actual results:

Nothing happen when i tried to double click on it or right click it and choose "open".




Expected results:

It should present a window asking me to choose an app to open the file or, directly opened it with "pdf viewer".

What strange, it's the fact that if the same pdf file is saved and opened in the browser, it can  be read but not from mail and news's attachment panel.

Summary: While page is loading <- and -> (the arrow keys) move the tabs inside the tab bar
Description:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:60.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/60.0

Steps to reproduce:

Load or Reload a page which is pretty large. While the page is loading quickly press arrow keys or POS1-Key or "END" Key


Actual results:

The tab moves within the tab bar


Expected results:

Nothing should happen.

When loading the page is finished, those keys navigate with the loaded page. So I see no reason, that during loading that behavior is different.

Summary: Memory leak and stalling on particular "Deutsche Welle" Page
Description:
Steps how to reproduce with installation of unofficial (by wg9s) De SeaMonkey 2.53.9 beta 1 Mozilla/5.0  (NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:60.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/60.0 Build 20210707210003 (Newly created User Profile, Default Classic Theme) on German WIN7 64bit:

1. visit [Spaniens erster Lockdown war verfassungswidrig](https://www.dw.com/de/spaniens-erster-lockdown-war-verfassungswidrig/a-58270280)
   ¬ª stalls PC with  AMD Ryzen 5 3600 6-Core Processo 3.60 GHz 16,0 GB  RAM üò•

### Additional Information  
a) Consumes 10 GB RAM, high CPU load  
b) No Problem with FF 92.0a1 (2021-07-13) (64-Bit)  
c) Migt be a DUP of one from [this list](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/buglist.cgi?o2=anyexact&v2=memory%20cpu&list_id=15772365&product=SeaMonkey&f2=longdesc&chfieldfrom=2016-01-01&chfield=[Bug%20creation]&f1=short_desc&query_format=advanced&j_top=OR&classification=Client%20Software&o1=anywordssubstr&v1=memory%20cpu).
d) I did not yet check whether this is a regression

Summary: Links in "Themes" section of add-ons manager directs user to Thunderbird Themes instead of SeaMonkey themes.
Description:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:60.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/60.0 SeaMonkey/2.53.9

Steps to reproduce:

I opened SeaMonkey, went to Tools menu > Add-ons manager, then clicked on "Themes" on left-hand side menu.
At the top of the themes page that opens up, there's a link that reads, "Looking to personalize your browser? Choose from thousands of themes." I clicked on the linked text.


Actual results:

The link took me to this page: https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/themes/?src=seamonkey. That URL appears to forward to https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/static-themes/, which seems to be the theme listing for Thunderbird themes.


Expected results:

I expected the link to take me to this URL (or another appropriate URL for SeaMonkey themes) instead: https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/seamonkey/complete-themes/

Summary: Severe memory usage
Description:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:60.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/60.0 SeaMonkey/2.53.8

Steps to reproduce:

sorry, all other related bugs was closed, see
https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1616551

1) Start Seamonkey browser:
User agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:60.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/60.0 SeaMonkey/2.53.8
2) use it for some days


Actual results:

1) the computer become unresponsive (one seamonkey task goes to high CPU use)
2) memory use increase much.
I noted in the task manager a typical saw tooth when this happen, see attach


Expected results:

memory use should remain low like with 2.49.5

Summary: Can't add a TLS exception for IRC server
Description:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:60.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/60.0 SeaMonkey/2.53.8

Steps to reproduce:

Try connecting to an IRC server which has a certificate whose Common Name(s) do(es)n't match the domain name of your IRC server. You can use datapacket.hk.ircnet.net port 6697 as a testcase. Then add an exception


Actual results:

The "Add Security Exception" window returns a No Information Available error.


Expected results:

Should be able to proceed with adding an exception.

Summary: Option to open "Add Security Exception" window never offered after failing connection to self-signed IRC server
Description:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:60.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/60.0 SeaMonkey/2.53.8

Steps to reproduce:

Try connecting to an IRC server with a self-signed certificate. You can use irc.blackaster.xyz port 6697 or 9999 as a testcase.


Actual results:

Connection fails as expected, but the option to add an exception is never offered. It consistently returns the following:

Connection to ircs://irc.blackaster.xyz/ (ircs://irc.blackaster.xyz/) closed with status 2153398258. Reconnecting in 15 seconds. 


Expected results:

Connection failing, and offer to add an exception. Like this:

ircs://irc.blackaster.xyz/ has an invalid security certificate. If you trust this server, [add an exception].

Summary: Unfinished drag-and-drop after appearing of MessagePane in Wide View
Description:
In short:

On the Wide View, if MessagePane was not shown before, it can cause to shrink folderPane and then occupies the bottom of previous folderPane's area. Thus, starting to leftclick on the folderPane, the releasing can occur already on the messagePane, which  on practice leads to hidden unfinished drag-and-drop.

Summary: Neither the "Message/Archive" function nor keyboard shortcut shift+A archives messages in the email/newsgroup window (v. 2.53.8) Mac OS 10.14.6 desktop
Description:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_14_6) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce:

Typed shift+A in the mailnews window.
I also selected "Archive" in the "Message" menu.


Actual results:

The selected message(s) was (were) not archived.


Expected results:

Message should have been archived.

Summary: OK button inoperative in SeaMonkey 2.53.8
Description:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.14; rv:60.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/60.0 SeaMonkey/2.53.7.1

Steps to reproduce:

click on a download link (pdf,...)


Actual results:

The "ok" button is inoperative in the registration window
Impossible to perform any action except cancel


Expected results:

The "ok" button should work!

Summary: edit page on readonly html file
Description:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.114 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce:

I opened my local html file in Version 2.53.8.1. This file was by mistake readonly. Go into edit mode by "File" -> "Edit Page". Change some text. Press save. Now if you close SeaMonkey your change is lost!


Actual results:

The user want to save, but the change is lost.


Expected results:

 I would suggest to at least warn the user by an error message that nothing has been saved, or ask user to overwrite the readonly file.

Summary: download manager status bar online/offline toggle does not work
Description:
The download manager status bar online/offline toggle is not working: clicking does nothing and it shows the "connected" icon even when SeaMonkey is in "Work Offline" mode.

Reproduced with 2.53.10b1pre 20210806210008 and 2.57a1 20210728120005.

Summary: Junk status resets after being unset
Description:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:90.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/90.0

Steps to reproduce:

On some messages that Seamonkey sets the junk flag on, if I click it off it resets to on after either waiting a bit or switching to another folder and back.  This also happens if I use the right click>Mark>As not junk option.  I'm using Windows 10 64 bit, and the Win64 version of Seamonkey 2.53.8.1, and this is happening even though I have turned off adaptive junk controls on the account! It is an IMAP account.


Actual results:

Mail junk flag turns back on after being set off.


Expected results:

Seamonkey should respect my judgment that the message is nor junk, and leave that flag off once I turn it off.

Summary: Drop leftover "Edit Menu" comment from messageWindow.xul and addressbook.xul
Description:
Both messageWindow.xul and addressbook.xul have an "<!-- Edit Menu -->" comment inside their broadcastersets, which used to precede broadcasters that applied to the Edit menu.

Those broadcasters are gone but the comments were not dropped: in messageWindow.xul, there is no broadcaster after the comment and in addressbook.xul it is followed by Communicator:WorkMode (which is for the File Menu and the status bar?).

Summary: In MailNews, opening a Calendar tab closes the Message Pane in the Mail tab
Description:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; WOW64; rv:60.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/60.0 SeaMonkey/2.53.8.1

Steps to reproduce:

1. In MailNews, enable Message Pane in View -> Layout
2. Click on the root folder of an email account, the one that displays "Read Messages, Compose a new message, etc"
3. Click Events and Tasks -> Calendar to open a new Calendar tab
4. Close the Calendar tab, or switch back to the Mail tab and click on Inbox, or another email folder.


Actual results:

The Message Pane is no longer there and must be selected again in View -> Layout


Expected results:

The Message Pane setting should be remembered

Summary: Google Drive inaccessible
Description:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:60.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/60.0

Steps to reproduce:

2/ Configure "Switch to new tabs when opened" to true
3/ Select a message in the first account
4/ Right click on a folder in the second account and select "Open in New Tab"

Expected result:
1/ Folder opens in new tab
2/ Folder from new tab is selected in folder pane
3/ Tab / mail window displays folder name from new tab

Actual result:
1/ Folder opens in new tab
2/ Folder from 1st tab is selected in folder pane
3/ Tab / mail window displays folder name from 1st tab

Summary: In ChatZilla make /commands return all matches starting with pattern

Summary: Stop using canonical name as collection keys
Description:
+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #498178 +++

Two potential solutions:

1) Implement a Dictionary/Mapping class to handle collections that avoids name clashes. This would require methods to replace iteration, getting and setting - and thus lots of code changes

2) Instead of using cannonicalName as the key, create a new property (collectionKeyName perhaps?) which is prefixed with some character which would be invalid for real methods.


The second of these is probably the better choice for this bug.

Summary: Update help for clear private data preferences and dialog
Description:

Summary: Non working spell checking - SM 2.53.9 (FreeBSD)
Description:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; FreeBSD amd64; rv:60.0) Gecko/20100101 SeaMonkey/2.53.9

Steps to reproduce:

Compile and install SM 2.53.9 on FreeBSD 12.2-STABLE (Aug 25).
Previous installation was SM 2.49.4.

Compose a new email



Actual results:

Every more than one letter word has a red squigly line under it as if a mispelling.

Console messages:
error: /usr/local/lib/seamonkey/dictionaries/en-US.aff: cannot open
error: /usr/local/lib/seamonkey/dictionaries/en-US.dic: cannot open
error: /usr/local/lib/seamonkey/dictionaries/en-US.aff: cannot open

-rw-r--r--  1 root  wheel   3.0K 18 Feb  2020 en-US.aff
-rw-r--r--  1 root  wheel   563K  8 Aug 23:01 en-US.dic

I have checked path permissions.
I checked also as the root user with the same result.

I tracked the error message down to filemgr.cxx where, as far as I can tell, the failure occurs:

  myopen(fin, file, std::ios_base::in);
  if (!fin.is_open()) {
    // check hzipped file
    std::string st(file);
    st.append(HZIP_EXTENSION);
    hin = new Hunzip(st.c_str(), key);
  }
  if (!fin.is_open() && !hin->is_open())
    fail(MSG_OPEN, file);               <<<<<<<< cannot open error msg




Expected results:

Spell check should work and all correctly spelt words should not be indicated as mispellings.

Summary: Constant EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION_EXEC-crashes with 2.53.9 even in safe-mode
Description:
Since upgrading from 2.53.8.1 to 2.53.9 I am getting immediately crashes when opening websites e.g. https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/ in SeaMonkey, in normal mode and safe-mode. 

The Crash-reporter is even popping up every time after quitting SeaMonkey or using "Help -> Restart with Add-ons disabled".

Downgrading to 2.53.8.1 solved the crashes. Upgraded to 2.53.9 again and get crashs again. Downgrading again to 2.53.8.1, no crashes. 

## Crash-Report
http://crash-stats.mozilla.com/report/index/bp-4667ce5c-9284-4a93-948b-06c390210915

## Workaround
- app.update.auto=false (Edit -> Preferences -> Advanced -> Software Installation -> Updates)
- Downgrade to 2.53.8.1

Summary: Can't type Facebook comments
Description:
As of last week, it's no longer possible to use SeaMonkey to type into the comments field under a Facebook post.  Changing the browser's user agent string (e.g., to report as Firefox) has no effect.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Log into Facebook and visit any post that your account has permission to comment on (e.g., https://www.facebook.com/ofai.at/posts/1842624699263160)
2. Click on the input field at the bottom of the post.  The input field gets focus and a flashing I bar appears.
3. Start typing.

Observed behaviour:
4. Nothing happens.

Expected behaviour:
4. The typed text should appear in the input field.

Note: I understand from the discussion at Bug 1655478 that unspecific Web compatibility bugs like this are not likely to be useful or be acted upon.  However, in this case the website affected is in the Alexa top 10 and there are already SeaMonkey-specific problem reports circulating online (e.g., [on Mozillazine](http://forums.mozillazine.org/viewtopic.php?f=40&t=3079789)).  Perhaps someone else who is affected by this bug and who has more time/knowledge than I do can pinpoint the cause enough to help the developers arrive at a fix.

Steps to reproduce:

2. Spend 30 minutes making many changes and hitting File > Save (Ctrl+S) often.
3. Close the file.


Actual results:

No changes were saved and no warnings given.


Expected results:

SeaMonkey should either prevent any edits to a read-only file, or it should give a warning the first time you try to save the file, offering the option of doing a Save As.

We describe the process step by step:
0. 
first three lines of xhtml file:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xml:lang="nl" lang="nl">
  <head>
....
1. open by seamonkey
2. edit (Ctrl-e) by seamonkey-composer
3. save (Ctrl-s):

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

....

if we try to open the last saved file again with seamonkey it has a problem in parsing the second line (which it had introduced itself!) and stops handling the file.


Expected results:

No extra line introduced which cannot be handled by parser.

Summary: ChatZilla cannot retrieve certificate exceptions on port 6697
Description:
If an irc server has an invalid certificate of some sort (e.g. self-signed or expired), then the exception dialog cannot retrieve the certificate via port 6697.
I believe this is because the dialog uses http to carry out this work and port 6697 is blocked for http.
Workaround is to add an override via about:config, network.security.ports.banned.override should include 6697 (if the pref does not exist it needs to be created as a string).

Changing that to aSearchTerms makes this option work.

Summary: ChatZilla: "Remember passwords" settings no more respected in v2.53.10
Description:
Steps to reproduce:

I updated SeaMonkey 2.53.9 to 2.53.10, which comes with a new version (0.10) of ChatZilla. "Remember Passwords" is disabled in my settings (Edit -> Preferences), and previously, Chatzilla doesn't try to remember passwords.


Actual results:

ChatZilla 0.10 tries to remember a channel key, for example when you typed
/join #channel key
It at least asks if the user wants it to remember the password, but the answer by default is "Yes".


Expected results:

Since "Remember Passwords" is (globally) disabled, ChatZilla should not remember any password. It shouldn't even ask, as the user's preference is clearly "Don't remember passwords."

The way it is now, assuming that someone can abuse my computer, there is a risk that they could join a private, keyed channel without knowing the key. This behavior did not exist in older versions of SeaMoenky/ChatZilla.

Summary: Mail&News' start.xhtml: "We" link broken
Description:
suite/mailnews/content/start.xhtml (in comm) currently includes a link that points to https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Mozilla/Projects/MailNews, which is now missing (404).

This is defined in suite/locales/en-US/chrome/mailnews/start.dtd (see bug 1140353).

Summary: Broken link to web components polyfill add-on in release notes
Description:
The FAQ in the release notes for SeaMonkey 2.53.10.2, and probably also for previous SeaMonkey versions, contains a broken link to the web components polyfill add-on.  This is particularly serious because the FAQ specifically directs people to download that add-on in order to get the SeaMonkey source code.

The link target is currently https://github.com/JustOff/github-wc-polyfill/accessible which returns a 404.  The link target should instead be https://github.com/JustOff/github-wc-polyfill.

Adding the exception chould have allowed access to the website

Summary: Seamonkey 2.53.7.1 has serious performance issues
Description:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:60.0) Gecko/20100101 SeaMonkey/2.53.7.1

Steps to reproduce:

I see this performance degradation  issue daily over time.  When I restart Seamonkey  after the performance issue it takes Seamonkey anywhere from 4 to 5 minutes to actually exit cleanly.  When running Seamonkey the performance degrades over time.


Actual results:

Ever since I upgraded to Seamonkey 2.53.7.1 from the older release Seamonkey's performance has degraded.  I constantly see things like these:
----
ATTENTION: default value of option force_s3tc_enable overridden by environment.

** (seamonkey:25048): WARNING **: GDBus.Error:org.freedesktop.DBus.Error.ServiceUnknown: The name org.freedesktop.Avahi was not provided by any .service files

WebGL(0x7f5007bd4800)::ForceLoseContext
----
and when monitoring performance with top I see Seamonkey running thread after thread even when on simple web pages.  I am also seeing a thread using 99.9% of the CPU processing when things get really degraded.  The other applications are not being effected - i.e. xterms, and other gui programs.  I basically have the email window open and two windows for web browsing using tabs.  Also note,  I am using Seamonkey 2.53.7.1 in the same fashion and setup that I have been using for over 20 years.   And I have folders and emails from the same period of time.  Top also indicates that no swap space is being used.

I upgraded to Slackware 14.2 from Slackware 14.0 and am using the same laptop and environment setup.  I have 24 GB of emails and data in the .mozilla/.cache directories and hundreds of folders and subfolders.  I also regularly compress folders when removing emails I do not need to keep.

I did try and build they very latest version but it requires a new compiler and will not build on Slackware 14.2.  And since one can not go back to the pre-2.53 release due to the incompatible updates I am stuck on 2.53.7.1 right now.  The latest version requires one to be Slackware 15.0

User Agent String: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:60.0) Gecko/20100101 SeaMonkey/2.53.7.1

Based upon system backups I believe I was running 2.49.5 or 2.53.4 before I did this update.  I am also using the same Window Manager - fvwm2.


Expected results:

The basic performance should not have degraded the way it has simply by upgrading to the new version.  And why threads are doing what they are doing does not make sense.

Summary: SeaMonkey runs out of memory and crashes on dw.com
Description:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:68.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/68.0 SeaMonkey/2.53.12

Steps to reproduce:

Go to this URL:

https://www.dw.com/ru/bolgariya-dogovorilas-s-ssha-o-postavkah-spg-po-cenam-nizhe-chem-u-gazproma/a-61765349


Actual results:

SeaMonkey very quickly runs out of memory and crashes.
This happens on a clean start with absolutely nothing open.
In the Task Manager, I see the memory usage going up very quickly
to something like 1.5...2 GB of RAM. This happens in 100% of cases.

NOTE 1: The crash reporter was able to send the dump a few times.
Most of the time the crash report itself is not started correctly,
so it also displays an error message.

NOTE 2: The same URL opened in Firefox (100.0 32-bit) works just fine.
Firefox has about 10 processes open (again, clean start), with the largest
taking about 160M of RAM. The memory does not go up and just stays
stable.


Expected results:

The browser should display the page.

This is SeaMonkey 2.53.12 (32-bit), Windows 7 (32-bit).

Summary: boards.straightdope.com renders blank
Description: Starting from a few days ago, the website https://boards.straightdope.com/ ‚Äì a popular online forum that uses [Discourse](https://www.discourse.org/) ‚Äì no longer works with SeaMonkey 2.53.12.  Visiting the site results in a completely blank page, even in a fresh profile in safe mode.  The site renders correctly in Firefox.

Summary: Performance issues with 2.53.12 are worse than 2.53.7.1
Description:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:68.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/68.0

Steps to reproduce:

I simply running Seamonkey with the mail window and 2 web windows open.  Seamonkey is using over 1 Gb of memory regularly and is regularly using 99+% of the processor when in a basic idle mode.  In one case I noticed with top Seamonkey was actively using over 2GB of memory.  It is also opening numerous threads even when Seamonkey is basically in an idle mode and static simple pages are displayed.

Or to summarize simply using Seamonkey to get email and have web pages displayed.


Actual results:

Seamonkey is not responding to keyboard and mouse command often and is using excessive amounts of system resources where the system stop responding normally.  These problems all started occurring when I started using the 2.53.7.1 release.  The performance issues have gotten worse with 2.53.12, which I downloaded from the Mozilla web site.  

I am also running into issues with Facebook and other sites which used to work fine.  Got a script error pop-up on the one site.  On Facebook I can not enter text but links will be followed.  I am using Seamonkey in the same way I have been for 20 or so years.  If I use Firefox, 68.12.0esr, to access the web sites I can do the stuff without a problem.  Even as I enter the bug issue Seamonkey is consuming 1.9GB of the 4GB of memory on the systems.  

I am running on the same system as I was using before when I flagged the performance issue with 2.53.7.1  The system is a 64 bit system with 4GB of memory and the .mozilla directory is currently at 23GB of space usage due to emails (20 years or more of data).  I often see, via top, 12 or more threads running using 50% or more of the processors.  And when I do a "quit" for seamonkey it often takes 5 minutes to shutdown.  Opening the email filter window and save data windows often take around 5 minutes before the windows are usable.

These performance issues should not be occurring and did not start occurring until the internal changes related to using the Firefox and Thunderbird engines started being done.


Expected results:

Seamonkey should be performing smoothly as it did prior to the 2.53 alterations.

I also flagged this performance issue a while back and it was closed since I was not using the current release.

Summary: link to youtube video is not always copied to clipboard
Description:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:68.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/68.0 SeaMonkey/2.53.13

Steps to reproduce:

Consider the following scenario:

    1. open a list of youtube videos e.g. https://www.youtube.com/user/UnitedSportsCar/videos
    2. right-click in the lower half of video preview picture. Dotted selection box appears around the picture, selecting "Copy link location" from context menu copies video URL to clipboard
    3. right-click close to the top of a video picture. Selection box around the picture doesn't appear, selecting "Copy link location" from context menu does NOT change clipboard contents - this is the main issue. Selecting "Open link in a new tab" works on both occasions, so I am definitely clicking on a hyperlink and so it should be copied on both occasions too.

This is not 100% reproducible: sometimes, usually the first time, clicking on the top works just like clicking on the bottom, if it happens, try again with another video.

Summary: Remove url whitelist from SeaMonkey
Description: With recent backports we ran into a cosmetic problem with the whitelist url cache. We do not have the pref webchannel.allowObject.urlWhitelist definied and with two domains no longer available and no one missing it before the whole functionality should just be removed in our 2.53 branch only. The cache part didn't work anyway because it was never set.

Summary: Address Book: "Get Map" button is not shown for home addresses
Description:
When displaying contacts/cards, the Address Book can show "Get Map" buttons for street addresses which are set, but currently (I've been testing with 2.53.12 and a 2.53.13b1pre build) it will only show this button for the work address.

This appears to be caused by the changes in bug 1428100. For both Home/Private and Work contact sections, there is a variable that signals whether there is content to display so far. In both SeaMonkey and Thunderbird, this variable is named "visible" for the Home/Private section and "addressVisible" for the Work section, but the suite/ part of the patch uses "addressVisible" for both sections.

Summary: SeaMonkey 2.53.13 crashes often (regression from 2.53.12)
Description:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:68.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/68.0 SeaMonkey/2.53.12

Steps to reproduce:

It seems that the 2.53.13 release is much worse that the previous 2.53.12 release.
The new release seems to be noticeably slower on many pages. Furthermore,
the browser crashes more often even from a clean start and a single page open.

The 3 sites, where I see this happening very consistently are these (there could be others):

* Yahoo Finance stock charts, for example (https://finance.yahoo.com/chart/PYPL)
* Google Spreadsheets
* E-Trade (requires a login)

Sorry, I do not have a public file for Google Spreadsheets. Most likely,
any table will cause problems. The one I use is a very trivial table,
no fancy charts or scripts. Just a small table with a few columns
and about 100 rows.


Actual results:

The browser is noticeably slower, often crashes. Sometimes the browser
shows clear signs of the screen corruption (and crashes soon).


Expected results:

The pages should open and work as expected (and were in 2.53.12).

Steps to reproduce:

Start Seamonkey


Actual results:

Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:-1.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/-1.0


Expected results:

The user agent should be something more like
Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:102.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/102.0
(copied from Firefox on the same machine).
Obviously the Windows and Firefox versions could be different - but anything but "-1"!
Setting general.useragent.override in about:config or user.js has no effect.

Summary: Email shows attachment inline, but no attachment is listed to view out-of-line
Description:
Steps to reproduce:

Turn "Display Attachments Inline" option on/off, when viewing an email with (possibly malformed) attachment.

User agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:68.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/68.0 SeaMonkey/2.53.12

Might be a Thunderbird issue, I don't have that installed to check on. I tried to search for existing bug on both Tb & Seamonkey, but am not used to the search options here & may have missed it.


Actual results:

When on, "Display Attachments Inline" shows the text attachment as desired.
When off, no attachments are listed to open and view.

(Attached sample file has only an attachment, which shows normally with "Display inline" on. When "Display inline" is off, the message appears completely empty.)


Expected results:

I expect that either the attachment would be ignored in both toggles [undesired, but if the message is malformed might make sense] 
OR all attachments shown inline would also be listed out-of-line.

Summary: Dead links in cs_nav_prefs_advanced.xhtml [en-US]
Description:
##  Dead links:
### 1. Prefetching  
In text "see the online [Link Prefetching FAQ](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/HTTP/Link_prefetching_FAQ)" -- Target language needs to be modified to "en-US", so that it will lead to [this page](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Link_prefetching_FAQ).    
  
### 2. Proxy Auto Configuration  
In text "see the online [MDN documentation on Proxy Auto-Configuration files](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/HTTP/Proxy_servers_and_tunneling/Proxy_Auto-Configuration_%28PAC%29_file)" -- Link target language needs to be "en-US" and should lead to [here](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Proxy_servers_and_tunneling/Proxy_Auto-Configuration_PAC_file)!

### Additional info
a) Probably also other Languages affected, at least for [De] both links in Help do not work  
b) Does someone see additional problems?  
c) I can create a "repaired" file and attach it here ; would also integrate fixes for "Bug 1269434 - cs_nav_prefs_advanced.xhtml: Typos"

Summary: Dead links and typos in cs_nav_prefs_advanced.xhtml [de]

##  Dead links:
### 1. Prefetching  
In text "siehe [Link Prefetching FAQ](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/HTTP/Link_prefetching_FAQ)" -- Target language needs to be modified to "en-US" because "de" dosnot exist. So it will lead to [this page](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Link_prefetching_FAQ).    
  
### 2. MDN documentation on Proxy Auto-Configuration files  
In text "Siehe [MDN documentation on Proxy Auto-Configuration files](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/HTTP/Proxy_servers_and_tunneling/Proxy_Auto-Configuration_%28PAC%29_file)  (englisch)" -- Link target language needs to be "en-US" and should lead to [here](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Proxy_servers_and_tunneling/Proxy_Auto-Configuration_PAC_file)!

Summary: Composer: leaving the "Source" tab overwrites the X11 primary selection
Description:
In SeaMonkey Composer on X11, switching from the "Source" tab to another tab will replace the primary selection with the content of the editable document source code (everything but the doctype line?).

To reproduce:
1) Open Composer, switch to the "Source" tab
2) Set the primary selection (for example, if xclip is installed, run "echo test | xclip -i" in a terminal emulator).
At this point, if you paste the primary selection (can be tested with "xclip -o", for example), it will show "test".
3) Switch to another tab in Composer
4) Check/paste the selection content (possibly with "xclip -o" again), it now pastes the document source from Composer.

Summary: security.warn_leaving_secure not enforced for redirects
Description:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:100.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/100.0

Steps to reproduce:

Set security.warn_leaving_secure = true
Test 1:
Go to: https://www.enet.umn.edu/
then: http://paulfm.com

Test 2:
Go to: https://www.enet.umn.edu/
Go to: https://www.aem.umn.edu/
(or even Go to: http://www.aem.umn.edu/ )


Note - this is specifically: Seamonkey 2.53.13
(I suspect the now current 2.53.14 release has the same bug - just haven't tested it yet).


Actual results:

Test 1: You are warned that the destination page is insecure.
Test 2: NO WARNING, even though "https://www.aem.umn.edu/" first redirects to "http://www.aem.umn.edu/" before it goes to: "https://cse.umn.edu/aem"
(in the obvious case of the user going directly to "http://www.aem.umn.edu/ " it still does not warn you as the final page is https).



Expected results:

Test2: The user should be stopped at "http://www.aem.umn.edu/" with a warning about leaving a secure page.

Actually, in all cases it would be better if the warning prevented the page from loading/downloading until you clicked what to do in the warning field (show site [or continue], block site, go back).

Even better (even if you don't have security.warn_leaving_secure = true), a server redirect from https to http should always stop and ask you to continue or not (maybe a new setting that defaults to that but can be turned off).  Note, a bad certificate should be treated that same a http in the case of redirection.
(a redirection through a non-secure page opens a user in a coffee shop up to numerous attracts by someone else in that coffee shop or the person running the wireless network).

I note that Firefox (incorrectly in my opinion) no longer supports security.warn_leaving_secure (people don't check the "icon" after they click a link on a secure page).  Setting that to default to true may actually start waking up (at least seamonkey) users to the insecure sites that are still on the internet (and maybe get firefox users to demand it be added back in).

Summary: Seamonkey window won't close. Keeps re-opening.

I think you know the answer to that question. :-)

Summary: dump_sys crashes on crosscompile with "terminating with uncaught exception of type std::out_of_range vector"
Description:
Currently MacOSX crosscompile buildsymbols seems to be missing the generation of the XUL symbols.

Even after a 'successful' generation of symbols, the XUL symbol dSYM tarball and .sym file were missing in the <objdir>/dist/crashreporter-symbols.

After much trial and error, it seems as if the symbolstore.py seems to be 'eating' up the
terminating error. 

Particularly: https://hg.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/file/tip/toolkit/crashreporter/tools/symbolstore.py#l580

 proc = subprocess.Popen(
                cmd,
                universal_newlines=True,
                stdout=subprocess.PIPE,
            )

As the <objdir>/dist/host/bin/dump_sys was built using the $CROSSCOMPILE$/macos/clang/lib path,  I tried the following manual run:

$ LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/data/crosscompile/macos/clang/lib /data/tmp/build/build/macosx/llvm-dsymutil --arch=x86_64 /data/tmp/obj-mac/toolkit/library/XUL

$ LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/data/crosscompile/macos/clang/lib /data/tmp/obj-mac/dist/host/bin/dump_syms  -g /data/tmp/obj-mac/toolkit/library/XUL.dSYM  /data/tmp/obj-mac/toolkit/library/XUL
terminating with uncaught exception of type std::out_of_range: vector
Aborted

At this point, I'm somewhat stumped as to what the issue is.  Since dump_syms worked on the other files [certutil et. al],  I'm guessing that something is funky with the 
creating of objdir/toolkit/library/XUL.

Filing this bug for reference.

Summary: Videos play with distorted audio when connecting with a SeaMonkey-only User-Agent string
Description:
On many websites, SeaMonkey plays embedded videos with highly distorted audio, but only when SeaMonkey transmits a User-Agent string that doesn't advertise Firefox compatibility.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Edit->Preferences->Advanced->HTTP Networking->User Agent String->Identify as SeaMonkey
2. Visit https://www.cbc.ca/player/play/763268675906 and play the video

Observed behaviour:
1. The video plays normally, except that the audio is highly distorted.

Expected behaviour:
1. The video should play with normal audio, the same way it does with Edit->Preferences->Advanced->HTTP Networking->User Agent String->Identify as SeaMonkey and advertise Firefox compatibility

Since the problem happens with many different websites, I assume the websites themselves are not sending garbled audio; rather, it's SeaMonkey that is not playing it properly.

Summary: SSL certificate is invalid for seamonkey-project.org
Description:
The SSL certificate the server presents when connecting to https://seamonkey-project.org/ causes web clients to emit warnings because it is valid only for www.seamonkey-project.org:

```
$ wget https://seamonkey-project.org
--2022-12-11 16:19:29--  https://seamonkey-project.org/
Resolving seamonkey-project.org (seamonkey-project.org)... 52.179.195.254
Connecting to seamonkey-project.org (seamonkey-project.org)|52.179.195.254|:443... connected.
WARNING: no certificate subject alternative name matches
        requested host name ‚Äòseamonkey-project.org‚Äô.
```

The resolution to Bug 1580858 and Bug 1574757 indicates that the certificate is supposed to be valid for both seamonkey-project.org and www.seamonkey-project.org so it looks like this may be a regression.

Summary: Rename devtools/shim to devtools/startup - SeaMonkey parts
Description:
Some changes were missed for SeaMonkey in the cc patches attached to bug 1444926

+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #1444926 +++

The name devtools/shim was chosen for DevTools gofaster, but since the addon plans are on hold, we could rename this folder to make it less confusing.

Since the folder contains all the startup code that can run before devtools are started or initialized, I think devtools/startup would be a good fit.

We should also cleanup all references to the devtools addon, and remove them.

Summary: Clicking a link in an email fails to open browser if browser has not been opened during the session
Description:
Steps to reproduce:

On Windows, with SeaMonkey not running, launch SeaMonkey Mail, then click on any link to any site in any email.

This issue began with 2.53.15; 2.53.14 and previous versions did not have this issue.

The issue does not occur if the SeaMonkey browser has been used since the current instance of seamonkey.exe was launched (either by the user explicitly launching the browser or by successfully launching it from an email); it only happens if the browser is being launched for the first time in this session by clicking a link in an email.


Actual results:

seamonkey.exe's CPU usage rises (to approximately the equivalent of one full core) for several seconds, Windows shows SeaMonkey as not responding, and then things go back to normal - but no browser window opens.  After this one episode, clicking links will work properly for as long as the instance of seamonkey.exe is running.


Expected results:

The browser window should open promptly, and without excessive CPU consumption or being shown as "not responding".

Summary: Broken link to SeaMonkey 2.53.16b1 download page

The [SeaMonkey 2.53.16 Beta 1 page](https://www.seamonkey-project.org/releases/2.53.16b1) links to the [release notes page](https://www.seamonkey-project.org/releases/seamonkey2.53.16/). In the "Downloading" section of these release notes is the following text:

> You can [download SeaMonkey 2.53.16 Beta 1 here](https://www.seamonkey-project.org/releases/2.53.16). 

The link points to the nonexistent resource https://www.seamonkey-project.org/releases/2.53.16 but it should instead point to https://www.seamonkey-project.org/releases/2.53.16b1.

Summary: Spellcheck no longer works with --enable-system-hunspell
Description:
I package SeaMonkey for openSUSE and we use `ac_add_options --enable-system-hunspell` in the `.mozconfig` file. This has worked for us up to and including SeaMonkey 2.53.15.  Starting with SeaMonkey 2.53.16b1, building SeaMonkey this way results in a non-functional spellchecker.  SeaMonkey still finds all the system dictionaries, and allows the user to select among them, but no matter which dictionary is selected, all words to be spellchecked are shown with a red wavy underline.  Meanwhile, the following sorts of error messages are printed to the system console:

```
error: file:///usr/share/myspell/de_AT.aff: cannot open
error: file:///usr/share/myspell/de_AT.dic: cannot open
error: file:///usr/share/myspell/de_AT.aff: cannot open
error: file:///usr/share/myspell/en_US.aff: cannot open
error: file:///usr/share/myspell/en_US.dic: cannot open
error: file:///usr/share/myspell/en_US.aff: cannot open
error: file:///usr/share/myspell/en_GB.aff: cannot open
error: file:///usr/share/myspell/en_GB.dic: cannot open
error: file:///usr/share/myspell/en_GB.aff: cannot open
```

Removing `ac_add_options --enable-system-hunspell` from `.mozconfig` restores the intended behaviour. (Interestingly, this is exactly the opposite of the workaround reported for Bug 1729113, which describes exactly the same symptoms.)

Some searching turns up Bug 1460600, which indicates that `--enable-system-hunspell` was removed from Firefox 62.  Has this change been backported to SeaMonkey 2.53.16b1?  If so, or if some similar change has been applied, perhaps this should be mentioned in the release notes so that users and packagers know not to use this option any more.

Summary: SeaMonkey version 2.53.16 calendar not properly displaying already-accepted event invitations on Windows 10
Description:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:109.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/111.0

Steps to reproduce:

Open Calendar in SeaMonkey 2.53.16 on Windows 10.
Step 1:  Hover mouse over existing events and the details seem to show correctly for all of them.
Step 2:  Double-click an event that was originally created by double-clicking in the calendar.  The "Edit Event:" form shows correctly for all these events.
Step 3:  Double-click an event that was originally created by accepting an invitation.  Rather than the small "Edit Event" form, a larger form is shown instead with:  1) no text in the header bar; 2) top-level menues for "Save and Close", "Accept", "Tentative", and "Decline"; 3) the body of the form has the word "General" in bold followed by a horizontal line, and "Title:" one line below that, and "Calendar:" one line below "Title"; much white space; and buttons for "OK" and "Cancel" in the lower right .  Neither button is functional.  This appears to be the form to accept an invitation, but this even has already been accepted (which is why it's in the calendar).  Click the "X" in the upper right to close the form and it does close, but now the mouse when hovered over the calendar is an hourglass; even so, it seems to be completely functional despite being the hourglass icon.
Step 4:  Close the calendar and open it again and everything seems back to normal, but you will start back at Step 1 each time.

Note A:  Because the details show on hover, I do not think the file local.sqlite is being corrupted.  I did try using the backup of this file I made before updating SeaMonkey to 2.23.16, and I got the same results.
Note B:  The pop-up Reminder form mostly works for events originally created by accepting an invitation, including the "Snooze for" feature.  But when I click on the "Details" link on the Reminder form for an affected event, I get the same issues as described above when trying to open it directly from the calendar interface.  For events created by double-clicking on the calendar, the pop-up Reminder works correctly in its entirety.

My conclusion:  Something is not being processed correctly for calendar events that were originally created by accepting an event invitation.


Actual results:

See "Step 3" description above.


Expected results:

The "Edit Event" form should show.

Summary: SeaMonkey is unable to access the macOS contacts starting with macOS 11
Description:
User in alt.comp.software.seamonkey complained that he is unable to access the macOS contacts in 2.53.16. Turns out the bug has nothing to do with the version but with apple changing requirements again. NSContactsUsageDescription needs to be added to the Plist file.
https://developer.apple.com/documentation/bundleresources/information_property_list/nscontactsusagedescription

Still works fine in 10.15 but confirmend broken in 13.3. 

For a detailed explanation see Bug 1720257

Summary: HTML Editor (Composer and HTML Email) creates <tb> elements when splitting <td> cells
Description:
Currently, InsertCell() (editor/libeditor/HTMLTableEditor.cpp), which is used to create table cells when splitting merged cells, creates <tb> elements for the new cells.

Visually, this can be reproduced by splitting a merged <td> cell: the now unmerged cell is visible, but there are no new cells filling the "gaps". If you check the source, you can see that there are new <tb></tb> elements where the new cells would be.

Summary: Remove $(perl) usage from SeaMonkey build files

Summary: SeaMonkey can not access the "macOS Address Book" in macOS 13.5 and 12.6.8 Betas
Description:
Despite bug #1826719 claiming that now it is possible to access the macOS contacts, on my systems the acknowledgedly broken "macOS Address Book" entry disappeared completely from the Address Book list of available address books.
Thus, it's still not possible to access macOS contacts from SeaMonkey.

The change landed between version [2023-04-02-21-00-03-comm-253](https://archive.mozilla.org/pub/seamonkey/nightly/2023/04/2023-04-02-21-00-03-comm-253/) (that display the "macOS Address Book" entry) and [2023-04-03-21-15-00-comm-253](https://archive.mozilla.org/pub/seamonkey/nightly/2023/04/2023-04-03-21-15-00-comm-253/) (that doesn't display the "macOS Address Book" entry any more). Please see the attached screenshots.

I've tested this behaviour on the latest Ventura and Monterey betas:
‚Äì macOS Ventura 13.5 (22G5059d) Beta 4 on Apple Silicon;
‚Äì macOS Monterey 12.6.8 (21G716) on Intel.

Summary: "control reaches end of non-void function" error when building cubeb
Description:
SeaMonkey 2.53.17b1 fails to build with GCC on openSUSE Tumbleweed, emitting an error when compiling cubeb:

```
[  286s] /home/abuild/rpmbuild/BUILD/seamonkey-2.53.17b1/mozilla/media/libcubeb/src/cubeb_utils.cpp: In function 'size_t cubeb_sample_size(cubeb_sample_format)':
[  286s] /home/abuild/rpmbuild/BUILD/seamonkey-2.53.17b1/mozilla/media/libcubeb/src/cubeb_utils.cpp:19:5: error: control reaches end of non-void function [-Werror=return-type]
[  286s]    19 |     default:
[  286s]       |     ^~~~~~~
[  286s] cc1plus: some warnings being treated as errors
[  286s] make[4]: *** [/home/abuild/rpmbuild/BUILD/seamonkey-2.53.17b1/mozilla/config/rules.mk:756: cubeb_utils.o] Error 1
```

The problem seems to be that GCC (possibly unlike Clang) is more fussy, or less intelligent, about reaching the end of a non-void function without a `return` statement, as occurs in `cubeb_utils.cpp`: 

```
size_t cubeb_sample_size(cubeb_sample_format format)
{
  switch (format) {
    case CUBEB_SAMPLE_S16LE:
    case CUBEB_SAMPLE_S16BE:
      return sizeof(int16_t);
    case CUBEB_SAMPLE_FLOAT32LE:
    case CUBEB_SAMPLE_FLOAT32BE:
      return sizeof(float);
    default:
      // should never happen as all cases are handled above.
      assert(false);
  }
}
```

The build config for cubeb seems to treat such return-type warnings as errors. The problem can be worked around by adding `  __builtin_unreachable();` after the `switch` statement; this is a non-standard compiler optimization hint that is recognized by GCC (and also Clang, I believe).  An alternative solution would be to update the build config for cubeb with something like `Wno-error=return-type`; I think some other third-party modules bundled with SeaMonkey do something similar.

The problem has already been reported upstream: https://github.com/mozilla/cubeb/issues/736

Summary: Mozillabuild (latest version 4.02) has msys directory as msys2, which Windows' build process fails to find the sh.exe
Description:
In the past, MozillaBuild's msys directory is "msys".  

In 2.53's mozilla-release, python/mozbuild/mozbuild/mozconfig.py has the
following (@ line 247):

        if 'MOZILLABUILD' in os.environ:
            shell = os.environ['MOZILLABUILD'] + '/msys/bin/sh'
        if sys.platform == 'win32':
            shell = shell + '.exe'


With MozillaBuild 4.02,  the msys directory is "msys2".

This has been fixed in m-c:
        if "MOZILLABUILD" in os.environ:
            mozillabuild = os.environ["MOZILLABUILD"]
            if (Path(mozillabuild) / "msys2").exists():
                shell = mozillabuild + "/msys2/usr/bin/sh"
            else:
                shell = mozillabuild + "/msys/bin/sh"
            prefer_mozillabuild_path = [
                os.path.dirname(shell),
                str(Path(mozillabuild) / "bin"),
                env["PATH"],
            ]

            env["PATH"] = os.pathsep.join(prefer_mozillabuild_path)

If we are to use MozillaBuild 4.02, this needs to be fixed.

I have 8 windows open with between 5 and 50 tabs each. Normally, SeaMonkey loads the content of all of them during Suite startup (disk cache is disabled, SM uses less than 1 of my 32 GB RAM, 1 GBit internet connection, Windows 10 with Defender).
With 2.53.17b1, only very few of those tabs are loaded during Suite startup, often not even the current one of each window (FireFox only loads the current tabs of all windows during startup). Mail is also affected, I can see the list of messages in several accounts, but selecting a message doesn't display it in the lower right of the mail window.

I'm using the following extensions:
ChatZilla 0.16 (or 0.17 with the beta version)
Context Search [converted] 0.6.3.1-signed
DOM Inspector 2.0.19 (might also be a newer version in the beta)
Enigmail 3.1.4 (manually upgraded from 2.0.9, but that's another bug)
HTTPS Everywhere 2022.5.11
Lightning 5.8.16
NoScript 5.1.9
PrefBar 7.1.1
RequestPolicy 0.5.28.1-signed.1-signed
uBlock Origin 1.16.4.30

I've also deleted everything in the directory appData\Local\Mozilla\SeaMonkey\Profiles\*\safebrowsing (as suggested in the Release Notes of SeaMonkey 2.53.17b1), but that made no difference.

Summary: Two mouse behaviors broke in 2.53.17:  1) scroll with mouse wheel press; 2) Mouse Gestures Suite add-on.
Description:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:91.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/91.0 SeaMonkey/2.53.17

Steps to reproduce:

1)  Updated to SeaMonkey version 2.53.17 on Windows 10.

2a)  Pressed and held scroll wheel on mouse to scroll web pages (browser) & emails (mail/newsgroups).

2b)  Depressed/held right mouse button and dragged the mouse to use gestures of Mouse Gestures Suite 2.5.1.

Both these behaviors do work in the previous version (2.53.16).  I list them together here rather than in two separate bug reports because they are both mouse-related and the behavior of SM is the same for both.  Also, I do realize that the Mouse Gestures Suite will eventually stop working, and maybe now is that time, and that MGS is not a Mozilla product.  But having both these mouse behaviors change in the same way at the same time seemed suspicious to me so I thought I'd report them together as perhaps they have a common cause.


Actual results:

2a)  Pressing the mouse wheel changes focus to a different control (if the mouse pointer is not over the control currently with focus), and that's all.  This happens at mousedown, and applies to giving focus to text boxes, buttons, check boxes, radio buttons, and likely other controls.  Pressing and holding does nothing more.  A full down/up mouseclick is not necessary to make this behavior happen.

When pressing the mouse wheel within a text box that already has focus, nothing happens -- i.e., the cursor is not moved.  Similarly, buttons and boxes are not clicked.  So it appears a full mouseclick event is not triggered.

After pressing the mouse wheel down and a different control is given focus, and while still holding the wheel down, it is possible to select and edit text within a text box (such as I'm filling out right now) using the keyboard.

2b)  As with the mouse wheel in 2a, pressing the right mouse button to initiate a gesture instead will change focus -- all the same behaviors described for the mouse wheel in 2a appear to apply here as well.  All Mouse Gestures Suite 2.5.1 functions are disabled, I presume because they are being preempted by this other mouse behavior.


Expected results:

2a)  Pressing and holding the mouse wheel should change the pointer icon, and allow scrolling.  Note that scrolling using the mouse wheel (without pressing it) does still work -- it is only press-and-hold that does not work.

2b)  Pressing/holding the right mouse button and dragging should allow for gestures to function.

Summary: Bad Links on SeaMonkey FAQ Wiki Page
Description:
I see some bad links on the FAQ page, wee pink highlighted strings in Attachment.

I will fix some within the next days, but for some I will need help.

Summary: Bad Contact Link
Description:
At the bottom of the project page below heading "Contact" I read "... send your question to the [support mailing list](mailto:support-seamonkey@lists.mozilla.org) and ..."

Sending a mail to that list I get some different messages.

## 1. "Successful Mail Delivery Report"

but also

## 2. "Delivery Status Notification (Failure)"
Hello rainerbielefeldng@bielefeldundbuss.de,

We're writing to let you know that the group you tried to contact (support-seamonkey) may not exist, or you may not have permission to post messages to the group. A few more details on why you weren't able to post:

 * You might have spelled or formatted the group name incorrectly.
 * The owner of the group may have removed this group.
 * You may need to join the group before receiving permission to post.
 * This group may not be open to posting.

If you have questions related to this or any other Google Group, visit the Help Center at https://support.google.com/a/lists.mozilla.org/bin/topic.py?topic=25838.

Thanks,

lists.mozilla.org admins

---
I doubt that that list really does exist. And/or can be accessed without registration or so.

Summary: search in e-mails doesn't work anymore
Description:
Steps to reproduce:

Right clic on inbox and choose search in messages


Actual results:

The search window opens, but all the previously defined parameters have disapeared.
First the Inbox folder isn't preselected. Second all the search criterias have disapeared. Even the search button is missing.


Expected results:

The search windows should have open as usual with all usual items.

Summary: Fix web protocol registration
Description: If you try to register a protocol (for example at http://permission.site/) you get a message in the error console about notificationBox not being defined.

Summary: seamonkey crashes with segmentation fault on specific website
Description:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:68.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/68.0 SeaMonkey/2.53.14

Steps to reproduce:

trying to load the page 
https://www.srf.ch/audio/radio-srf-3-live-hoeren


Actual results:

immediately after loading the page, seamonkey crashes with 
/usr/bin/seamonkey: Zeile 140: 16509 Speicherzugriffsfehler  (Speicherabzug geschrieben) $MOZ_PROGRAM "$@"


Expected results:

start playing the music stream
---
This is on OpenSuse 15.5, seamonkey installed from OpenSuse Main repo
The crash only occurs on this specific site, as far as seen by now
The page loads normal in Firefox 115.1.0esr and worked normal in seamonkey during years until the upgrade from OpenSuse 15.3 ->15.4 -> 15.5

Summary: Seamonkey 2.53.17 no longer displays message filters correctly (filter rule).
Description:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/116.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce:

I work with the French language.
I go to Seamonkey Messaging.
I click on Tools -> Message filters...
I click on New... or Modify... as appropriate.
To create or modify a message filter (filter rule).


Actual results:

In Seamonkey 2.53.17, when I go to the Message Filters box and display a filter rule (new or old), the box is empty.
I can no longer create new filters or modify an existing one.


Expected results:

Normally, I should have seen the filter rules displayed and been able to modify them.

Expected results:

Summary: Seamonkey displays webpages as empty
Description:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:91.0) Gecko/20100101 SeaMonkey/2.53.17.1

Steps to reproduce:

Open https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/select


Actual results:

The page is shown empty


Expected results:

It should show the page as any other browser does - especially since it is one of mozilla's own pages.

In general I more and more often have to switch to another browser, because Seamonkey show a blank page, or elements on the page does not react to input.

Summary: On MacOS saving to a filename with space character does not work
Description:
Steps to reproduce:

Open html file with space in name, edit file and use CMD+S to save. 


Actual results:

Opening html file in browser does not show any changes. File attributes also does not show any changes. Saving to new file without spaces works.


Expected results:

File with space in filename should save without problems or at least show error message.

Summary: Autosubscribe & remove expired message links open in new window
Description:
+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #129574 +++

Build ID: 2002-03-07, All OSs.

Summary: Autosubscribe URLs should use/focus the currently open mail window.

Type of URLS this covers:

[Expired Articles]:
news://nospam@news/netscape.public.mozilla.mail-news?list-ids

[Autosubscribe]
news://news.mozilla.org/netscape.public.mozilla.mail-news
news:netscape.public.mozilla.mail-news

Testcase URL:

http://www.mozilla.org/quality/mailnews/tests/sea-mn-newsgroup-function.html#URI

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Have a mail window open already.  In browser, type:
    news://news.mozilla.org/netscape.public.mozilla.mail-news [OR]
    news://netscape.public.mozilla.mail-news (should spawn Account Wizard)

Expected Results:

Mail window gets focused, account setup begins (or, confirmation if you used the
complete URL with the server info).

Actual Results:

A new mail window is spawned, and the correct events occur.  But we shouldn't be
spawing a new window.  This is 4xp.

Summary: packed_simd_2 fails to build
Description:
Building SeaMonkey 2.53.17.1 with a recent version of Rust fails: "error: could not compile `packed_simd_2` (lib) due to 6 previous errors"

Apparently this issue has the same cause (and probably the same solution) as Firefox Bug 1849874.

Summary: Incorrect browser version in user agent when resistFingerprinting is enabled
Description:
Steps to reproduce:

- Enable privacy.resistFingerprinting in about:config
- View user agent in about: or a website


Actual results:

User agent is "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:-1.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/-1.0"
Version is incorrectly -1.0. Seamonkey uses a now-incorrect formula to predict the latest ESR release and is possibly getting the incorrect current version number (nsRFPService::GetSpoofedUserAgent in toolkit/components/resistfingerprinting/nsRFPService.cpp).


Expected results:

Firefox version number should be something more sensible. In firefox upstream the user agent version is pretty much hardcoded through the build system.

Summary: E-mails without 'Quoted printable' MIME code for 8 bit coded messages are not always delivered
Description:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; WOW64; rv:91.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/91.0

Steps to reproduce:

Internetprovider KPN in The Netherlands and many more uses for e-mail 8 bit coded text instead of 7 bit. In the preferences I need to select: 'Quoted printable' MIME-codering gebruiken voor berichten die 8-bits tekens bevatten. If I unselect this option, many e-mails are not delivered and I will not receive many e-mail from many senders. This bug exists for many years in SeaMonkey E-mail.


Actual results:

If I unselect this option, many e-mails are not delivered and I will not receive many e-mail from many senders.


Expected results:

Receiving and delivering all e-mails.

Summary: Add OpenPGP Email Encryption support or make Enigmail appear in Add-on search results
Description:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/119.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce:

OpenPGP is not integrated on SeaMonkey, as it is on Thunderbird. Also Enigmail is available for SeaMonkey, but it doesn't show up in the search list. Plus I had to add a 'security exception' just to load the Enigmail website on the SeaMonkey browser.  


Actual results:

Actually I found the Enigmail Download for SeaMonkey on the Enigmail website, it wasn't found when searching for add-ons in SeaMonkey. https://enigmail.net/index.php/en/download/download-enigmail 


Expected results:

Enigmail should be found when searching the add-ons in SeaMonkey's "Add-ons Manager", but it's not.

Thank you.

Summary: Freeze on Linux (out of memory) if deleting many history entries
Description:
Steps to reproduce:

8 GB, 15 GB swap, select maybe well over 100,000 history entries, select delete. This was observed on 2.53.18 beta 1. Debian buster (oldoldstable).


Actual results:

I watch ("System Monitor") because Seamonkey annoyingly leaks (on this 32GB laptop, to 4-5GB) and then as the used memory is reduced, one thread goes to 100% and all Seamonkey activity is blocked while I suppose Garbage Collection is done.
During the delete historyoverkill, Seamonkey is blocked, (virtual) memory very slowly goes to 98-99%, then swap is very slowly to 100%, then there is no thread at 100% - instead Seamonkey is quiescent. I did not see that any history entries were deleted after I killed and restarted.


Expected results:

If only 100 or 1,000 (or maybe more, a couple of bunches), Seamonkey will slowly go through the selected entries, occasionally refresh the History window (although it is not clear it changed the window's content) and eventually refreshes the window, showing the top entry as selected, and reflects that the selected entries have been deleted.

Summary: emoji not colored
Description:
Steps to reproduce:

Use Seamonkey in Windows 11 23H2

Visit http://getemoji.com/


Actual results:

Emoji from two or maybe even three fonts are displayed. See attached screenshot.


Expected results:

Firefox bundles EmojiOne on certain platforms for a reason: Because they have no or incomplete emoji support. Therefore on platforms where Firefox ships EmojiOne, that font should take precedence over competing, incomplete fonts.

Bonus points for an additional option in the font configurator to pick the preferred emoji font. Considering that Twitter, Google, etc. also make free emoji sets, users may wanna pick their favorite set.

Summary: Subscribe to mail folders is broken
Description:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.14; rv:91.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/91.0 SeaMonkey/2.53.18

Steps to reproduce:

Upon opening SeaMonkey Mail & Newsgroups, many folders are missing from the directory in my primary IMAP mail account. I opened File:Subscribe... and the missing folders were listed. I clicked the checkbox next to each missing folder. In some cases, the checkmark did not appear. In other cases, the check mark appeared after a wait of up to 30 seconds. I clicked the Subscribe button, and closed the Subscribe... dialog. 

Please note that clicking the Refresh button at any time reverts the checked folders to the unchecked state, even after clicking the Subscribe button.


Actual results:

The subscribed folders did not appear in the mail folder directory after clicking the Subscribe button. Multiple repetitions of the same process sometimes succeeded in making one or two of the missing folder appear, but upon closing the Mail & Newsgroups app, the folders had disappeared. In no case was it possible to get the missing folders to appear in the mail folders directory. After selecting all folders and clicking the Subscribe button, clicking the Refresh button should populate the mail folders directory with all folders checked and subscribed.


Expected results:

All mail folders in the IMAP account should appear in the mail folders directory after subscribing to them in the Subscribe... dialog.

I consider this a serious bug, as it prevents the user from accessing messages in the missing folders in the IMAP account. One of the missing folders is the Unsent Messages folder. When prompted "Do you want to send unsent messages?" there is no way to review the unsent messages to determine whether or not to send them.

User agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.14; rv:91.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/91.0 SeaMonkey/2.53.18
